title: Update utils in prep for 1.0
body:
utils audit:

This change was made on 7929b6e0cd392cbe9026740ee9ad83bcf1f392c5

Most utils were last bumped in  20c66b705b5f0e76e51419147a2a262fd1aa792d
except for pattern (0e99bd581ab4d4f0d809cf2317fb46e90a6c1af2) and tzif (38f2736c66)

 - crlify:  no change
 - databake:  no change
 - deduplicating_array: surface-level code lint changes, nothing important
 - fixed_decimal: needs breaking bump
 - litemap: ~minor change to panic message, nothing important~ definitely breaking
 - pattern: UNUSED
 - tinystr: needs breaking, fix zerovec dep
 - tzif: license-only changes, not used yet
 - yoke: no change, 
 - zerovec: definitely breaking

This leads to a breaking bump for zerovec, tinystr, fixed_decimal, and nothing else.

title: Move `decimal-bn-en.postcard`
body:
Splitting this off from #2582 to get some better numbers.

This removes the tiny-c-test-specific `decimal-bn-en.postcard` from `icu_testdata` and `icu_capi`. The `tiny.c` test instead uses datagen (via Makefile) to create the file and include it in the binary, and then loads it via buffer provider. This reduces feature complexity on `icu_capi`, and serves as an example how to use datagen in a more complex build.

title: Less building in CI
body: Building `--all-targets --all-features` takes about 15 minutes on CI and builds too many targets, or targets with the wrong features that cannot be reused. It also weird if the ffi test fails because of a bug in some benchmark. Let's let cargo figure out what needs to be built.

title: Warn against breaking the Pernosco integration of CharacterAndClass
body: Pernosco helpfully has special knowledge to render `CharacterAndClass` in a more usable way that generic DWARF would allow. Adding comments to warn against breaking this integration.

title: Improve performance of VarZeroVec::deserialize and add provider benches
body:
Fixes #2600

After @zbraniecki noticed a performance issue with StaticDataProvider's constructor, I looked into the code with @Manishearth  and found some low-hanging fruit to optimize. I managed to get a 63% improvement, as shown below with the new benches run across the second commit in this PR:

```

  3 (3.00%) high severe

                        Change within noise threshold.
Found 5 outliers among 100 measurements (5.00%)

  2 (2.00%) high mild
  2 (2.00%) high severe

Benchmarking provider/construct/baked: Collecting 100 samples in estimated 5.0000 s (18446744074B                                                                                                   provider/construct/baked                        
                        time:   [0.0000 ps 0.0000 ps 0.0000 ps]
                        change: [-45.396% -1.3066% +75.734%] (p = 0.98 > 0.05)
                        No change in performance detected.
Found 12 outliers among 100 measurements (12.00%)
  4 (4.00%) high mild
  8 (8.00%) high severe

provider/load/static    time:   [117.46 ns 117.92 ns 118.47 ns]                                 
                        change: [-0.8186% +1.4342% +4.4178%] (p = 0.35 > 0.05)
                        No change in performance detected.
Found 17 outliers among 100 measurements (17.00%)
```

title: Rename FFI constructors
body:
All constructors are named `create` or `create_...`.

I used the following heuristics:

- If the constructor corresponds to something that takes options in ICU4X, call it `create_with_...`
- If it corresponds to a From impl in ICU4X, where it converts one type to another, call it `create_from_...`
- A case that doesn't fit nicely into these rules is `create_for_locale` and `create_for_kind` in Calendar
- String constructors are named `create_from_string`

title: Turn ZeroVec into a struct
body:
This avoids branches in most cases by avoiding the enum discriminant check, instead stuffing the discriminant into the zero-ness of the vec.

Supersedes https://github.com/unicode-org/icu4x/pull/2554


Seems to give a ~10% improvement, but some of our benches are flaky.

title: Removing `StaticDataProvider`
body: With databake being production-ready, there's no use case for `StaticDataProvider` anymore. I've left a hidden constructor on `BlobDataProvider` for use by testdata, but I don't think this should be public, as any client in the position to call it should use databake.

title: Add ExactSizeIterator
body:
This PR adds `ExactSizeIterator` to `FlexZeroVec`, `ZeroMap`.
ESI cannot be added to `VarZeroSlice` as `core::iter::Chain` does not have an impl for ESI.

title: Avoid testdata dependency from icu_capi
body: To use blob provider (via `buffer_provider` feature) from `icu_capi`, I would like to remove `testdata` dependency from `icu_capi` when using `buffer_provider`. Although original discussion was https://github.com/unicode-org/icu4x/issues/849, icu_capi has testdata dependency now unfortunately.

title: Initial constructor documentation overhaul
body:
This PR is based on the excellent feedback on https://github.com/unicode-org/icu4x/issues/2348#issuecomment-1249563656. I made the following improvements:

1. A brand new documentation page about constructors, which includes a decision chart similar to `std::collections`
2. Links to that documentation page from all constructors
3. Some editorializing in both the new documentation page and the main `icu_provider` page about why data providers are important and what explicit data providers achieve (I incorporated some text from Zibi's post)
4. Examples on each source data provider demonstrating how it works with its corresponding constructor (BlobDataProvider, StaticDataProvider, FsDataProvider, and AnyPayloadProvider)

I started by updating `icu_decimal::FixedDecimalFormatter`. If these changes look good, I'll do them to all the rest of the constructors.

What I did _not_ do in this PR is address concerns involving BakedDataProvider. That deserves its own PR, including a tutorial on how to leverage BakedDataProvider in your build.rs file.

We're almost done.

This contains some scriptextensions changes, but I think we need to go back and fix up icu::properties::Script first and then make an FFI that matches it. Happy to remove the ignores for that.

title: More updates to datetime docs
body:
Fixes #2513

- [X] In main example, the comment string should be “Calendars match” instead of "Formatting should succeed" for the .expect() call for `formatted_date`. See how the examples work in e.g. ZonedDateTimeFormatter.
- [X] Add module-level docs to icu::datetime::time_zone
- [X] TypedZonedDateTimeFormatter example does not assert what the output is equal to, but should
- [x] ZonedDateTimeFormatter examples somewhere should use a non-GMT time zone
- [x] The TimeZoneFormatter::load_*() functions return themselves, so that you can chain. We should say that in the docs
- [X] In general, TimeZoneFormatter is a power user thing, and the docs should say so
- [X] Because of this, remove the top-level reexport of TimeZoneFormatter, and leave it as icu::datetime::time_zone::TimeZoneFormatter (and update the diplomat rust_links and coverage tool to reflect this)
- [X] Ensure all experimental modules are marked as such (sub-issue: #2409)
- [X] In icu_timezone: Specify that that Zone Variant is optional, which is why you don’t need a generic variant

title: Whack-a-mole part 6
body:
We're almost there. Couple things remaining:

 - char16trie: should we just experimental this?
 - PluralOperands::n: this needs libstd, I find it to not be that useful a function anyway, perhaps we skip for now?
 - A couple Locale functions: need to write minor FFI
 - ScriptExtensions: need to write medium FFI

title: Fix Segmenter's missing FFI
body:
Change `icu_segmenter` to `icu::segmenter` in segmenter_grapheme.rs. This removes `segment_latin`, `segment_str`, and `segment_utf16` from the missing_apis.txt.

Add all the types and types aliases that need no FFI to the IGNORED_PATHS.

title: Refactor from for loop append to extend
body:
As per #2482 I refactored 2 places in `normalizer` from

```rust
for {
  vector.push(...)
}
```

to `vector.extend(...)` following suggestion in the issue description

title: Remove heapless feature from serde-json-core.
body:
provider_fs has serde-json-core crate dependency and it has heapless crate dependency as default if using default feature.

When using cargo vendor (we use it in Gecko), a lot of unnecessary crates are copied since heapless has a lot of dependencies. So I would like to avoid it.

title: Rename `write_len`
body: Fixes #2510

title: Remove `format_to_write`s
body:
* Removing `format_to_write`s from `icu_datetime`
* Adding `format_to_string`s everywhere we have a `format`
  * Changing the ones in `icu_datetime` to the canonical implementation
* Changing all tests that used `format_to_write` or `format_to_string` to `format` with `assert_writeable_eq`

Fixes #2511

title: Fix feature specification in provider/fs
body:
Fixed `feature` references in `provider/fs` modules that are used in benchmarks by creating `feature`s that are named the same following the examples in `ffi` crate.

This should fix issue #2525

title: Configurable DataProvider FFI
body: Progress on #2136

title: Hide fields of certain non-provider library structs
body:
Fixes #2417

I scrubbed the library code. The two structs mentioned in the issue were the only ones that seemed good for making this change. There are a lot of other structs I analyzed, but I excluded them if they were:

- In a `provider` or `serde` module
- `#[doc(hidden)]`, private, experimental, or test code
- Newtypes
- Enums
- Things that appeared to be intended for public manipulation, like CodePointTrieHeader
- Things that are in low-level modules, like `datetime::fields` and `plurals::ast`

title: Change IO in icu_codepointtrie_builder
body:
1/N for #1884 

Switching to a faster IO in [list_to_ucptrie.cpp](https://github.com/unicode-org/icu4x/blob/main/components/collections/codepointtrie_builder/cpp/list_to_ucptrie.cpp)

```shell
time cargo run --release --bin=icu4x-datagen --features=experimental,bin -- --icuexport-root=provider/testdata/data/icuexport --syntax=postcard --out=/tmp/icu4x_data --overwrite --keys=segmenter/word@1 --all-locales
```
 
HEAD 
```shell
real    0m2.999s
user    0m3.014s
sys     0m0.225s
```

This PR 
```shell
real    0m0.812s
user    0m0.843s
sys     0m0.222s
```

title: Use char instead of U24 in normalizer data
body:
char now has the same 3-byte ULE representation as U24, so the postcard and
the baked form do not change. (The JSON form changes, though.)

Addresses one item from #2458.

title: Fix arithmetic in Indian calendar
body:
Fixes #2476

I didn't bother to include day-of-week stuff in the test because day-of-week works by converting to iso first in all calendars, so testing the iso roundtrip is accurate is sufficient


I did test the testcases with ICU (Chrome)

title: Assorted TimeZone fixes
body:
Depends on #2470
Fixes #2425
Fixes #2473
Fixes #2474

This PR builds on #2470 with some additional small fixes according to 1.0 issues.

title: Stop returning error on mismatched locale and type calendar
body: Fixes #2402

title: Create options bag for CollatorOptions
body:
Fixes #2415 

Does the following:
* creates new options bag struct to take the place of `CollatorOptions`
* keeps the previous bit field as `CollatorOptionsBitField`  (could be removed in a future PR if desired)
* Collator private field kept the same (type renamed to `CollatorOptionsBitField`) to allow for minimal code change
* Collator constructor now converts input `CollatorOptions` (options bag) to `CollatorOptionsBitField` before storing in private field of Collator
* New enums created to represent on/off collator options that were previously handled as booleans

title: Whack-a-mole part 4: PluralRules, some properties
body:
I wasn't quite sure what to do with PluralOperands::n(), which requires std. Should we add an `std` feature to the FFI crate and have it panic in no_std?
